website_summaries.verdict: Consider this alternative premium radar detector if you want a more straightforward control interface.
pros: Provides the same set of laser and radar detection features as other premium models
Organizes controls in a simple layout
Front display is easy to read for occupants in the car
cons: The radar detector doesn't include a false detection limiter

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This radar detector is great! It does an excellent job filtering out false detections and has saved me many times from speeding tickets. The attached video shows you what I mean. This detector gives you plenty of warning and can read a radar gun practically a half mile away.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Blount

customer_reviews.title: I I have been using this for 6 months and ...
customer_reviews.text: I I have been using this for 6 months and it has never made a peep. I've driven by multiple police that I'm certain have had their radar on, I've driven by parked police that I know have had their radar on and it is never once warn me of anything. Luckily I have kept within the speed limits . The reason I didn't return it is because I thought I had the settings wrong but I have tried everything it is obviously a faulty unit. I can't comment on how one that is in working condition operates but this one is completely worthless to me. $150 down the tubes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. There are lots of false alarm on this model, but it's ok. It gives off a really strong warning when it detects a speed gun somewhere or is being aims at the vehicle with this scanner (very discerning), which is a plus and it's quite far before you even see the patrol car. You can remove the "intro" sound when you plug it on or when it starts with the "on" key (if it's hard wired). It's a totally fine scanner, not perfect, but will give you a heads up as early as expected.
customer_reviews.author: kwiksilber

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend CR90
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the performance of this product compared to my 15 year old Escort. It is constantly warning...and that’s even with X Band turned off. No way to “really” know if threat is real or not. Get K Band warning in my driveway...with nothing around. Ka band has way shorter warning than my old Escort. Have not picked up a Laser warning yet. Also seems cheaply made. Get what you pay for I guess. Going to see if I can return the device.
customer_reviews.author: Eldred Champine

customer_reviews.title: It is fun to use
customer_reviews.text: In states where it is legal(most of them), it provides the highest protection i have ever found (*It doesn't warn of Lazer that is behind a hill***(none that I'm aware of do...of course).. It is fun to use, customization is easy, and full operation in a short moment. It alerted me on nationwide trips without a miss, over and over. The best so far that i have ever used. I would buy it again. And i do recommend it when the subject is mentioned... for sure!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work or you will never know if it works, I drive 72 miles one way to work and 72 miles back, I go onto 3 different highways and regular roads and this thing always goes off, it is always beeping and I have passed police sitting in the median 5 times and it did not go off when going by them, so I have no idea if it works or not, it's sensors are no good, always going off.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Abbaticchio

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This bastard picks up everything. I have a ~40 minute drive to work daily all on 2 lane back country roads. This thingy paid for itself the first week I had it. On the interstate, this thing goes nuts. I'm not sure what truckers have in their cabs but it constantly makes this device beep. Probably crap on the interstate itself that makes it go off also. Must buy if you want to haul ass.
customer_reviews.author: longnuts

customer_reviews.title: Super bad
customer_reviews.text: It was working good, "apparently" but just after a week of having it, stops working... I have had a cobra radar for like 6 years and nothing happened to it, the reason why I got another one is because I had an accident and the towing company of my previous car stole it... I'm definitely going back to cobra.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: First Radar and Glad I Purchased
customer_reviews.text: I am 25 and have wanted a radar for years, but never pulled the trigger. This is my first one and I am pleased. Sure it sometimes goes off when a car comes by on the highway with lane changing lasers, but when an officer is scanning, you will learn to know the difference in the sounds it makes. I love this thing and after 3 weeks of ownership I am glad to have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan

customer_reviews.title: After a month I'm still tweaking and fine tuning the settings
customer_reviews.text: I needed to update my old detector since 1/2 of the cars on the road have blind spot monitoring and/or adaptive cruise and it kept getting false signals. After a month I'm still tweaking and fine tuning the settings, but the number of false signals is almost zero with this Whistler. Saved me from one ticket so far. The only negative I can think of is that it's powered by a cigarette lighter only(No lighter in my 2018 Ram). I had to buy an adapter so I could plug it into my usb for power. Haven't tried updating it via the usb/online option.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought 2018, very impressed.
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out and works great! (I see allot of people complain about it's settings, you can change that!) This comes with a USB so you may do updates when available. It also comes with gps and sensitivity settings. I'm very impressed off of what a $150 radar detector can do. Yes it's not THE best, but it DEFINITELY is one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Rapdoc

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the price.
customer_reviews.text: A great detector at a great price. I have found it to be reliable and it has certainly saved me tickets on several occasions. Some false alarms but once you use it awhile it is easy to tell when it is the real deal zapping you. Love the blue display and the country accent of the voice functions never fails to amuse passengers. I wish it was made in USA like my old Whistler however.
customer_reviews.author: Gutter Rock

customer_reviews.title: Hasn’t let me down yet.
customer_reviews.text: Depending on your budget this is an awesome device to go with. It goes off when it needs to and doesn’t seem to go off as much as my cheaper one around newer cars. Only thing I have a complaint about is the suction cups which I just swapped out with others I had laying around. Definitely would recommend to anyone. In fact, already have to a friend and they love it too!!
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Lighting colors could be better
customer_reviews.text: Color scheme is bad, K band is red and stands out but K band is usually collision radar on other cars, KA band is green and blue lights and harder to notice it going off if music is loud, i may be able to turn off K band or its sensitivity but it goes off allot moee then any other detector i have had other then that it does give you plenty of warning on KA as long as you see it
customer_reviews.author: A customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this Radar for 9 months now and it’s good for the cost. I drive about 600 miles every week and it has great detection. Sometimes it’ll detect newer cars like new Escalades or GMC Yukon’s other than that’s this is a great Radar for just a little over 100 bucks. The suction cups on mine work great. I’ve moved it from my wife and I’s car a couple times and it still holds on great. Definitely worth the 100 or so bucks you spend on this, had a passport redline before this and this works just as good as that 450 dollar passport.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon A.

customer_reviews.title: Good product if you understand what its supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I've seen some bad reviews for the CR70 but I like mine. Most reviews are due to ignorance. This is a "radar detector" not a police cruiser detector meaning it only picks up radar and laser. IT DOES NOT LOOK FOR POLICE CARS! If the police do not have their radar or laser on, it will not detect that. As far is people complaining about the false alerts, there is a setting to correct this. Read your manual!
customer_reviews.author: anthony may

customer_reviews.title: The Whistler is louder and the voice thing is nice thus the 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: So far I've only used it a week and haven't really played with it but its default setting sure seem to give a lot of false alarms. My past detector was the Escort 8500, on the same path to work everyday, It always picked up the cops with a lot less Noise. The Whistler is louder and the voice thing is nice thus the 3 stars. Dont bother with the intellicord. Its just another cigarette plug with a short cord and a push button to silence alarm. Just silence at the detector and save a few bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: A very nice radar detector
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy my cr90. Does what the articles said. I think its kind of low key which I like. I used the cable and connected it to my pc for updates. How neat is that. I really like that feature because I know I am updated to the last time I hooked it to the pc. A very great purchase. Yes, I do not leave home without it. Enjoy your cr90.
customer_reviews.author: Joe F. Clark III

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new but didn't get . Package had been opened
customer_reviews.text: I new something wasn't right when I saw the box wasn't sealed . The power cord wasn't tied up and other items were just stuffed in the bags . It seems to work OK but I should have paid a "used " price . I think I should pay the $85 that I see the advertised for used ! We'll see
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Hoped for a little more quality
customer_reviews.text: Well. Performance seems to be there. But. When plugged in i get alternator whine through the speakers. ferrite cores and capacitor dont seem to help filtering it out. Also no seperate volume control for voice and now speaker crackles when it speaks. Second whistler product owned
customer_reviews.author: hahano404

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: It unusual for me to write a "not so good" review, but this radar detector is simply NOT as good as I expected, a ton of false alarms , not just on K, but a lot of Ka and Pulse false alarms.. Still hasn't gone off on speed camera's, when my GPS did???? I like my old PRO 68 better. The 68 had much better Ka warning and NO Ka False Alarms. . Wait and go with the Uniden DR7 when it comes down in Price
customer_reviews.author: nuffer

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this radar detector to anyone in search of good ...
customer_reviews.text: This radar detector is well worth purchasing. It performed beyond my expectations, I guess when the company developed it to be "high performance" they really ment it. The Whistler CR85 out-performed the other radar detectors that I own, its voice prompts and range of coverage is unmatched. I would recommend this radar detector to anyone in search of good item at a fair price. Thank you Amazon for making a lot of quality items available on-line at fair and reasonable prices.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Carvalho

customer_reviews.title: Perfect out of box
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and all i had to do was suction it to the glass and plug it in. I havent had any false alerts but i will update my review if anything goes bad. I am a delivery driver so this really helps me drive full time, I dont believe it has 360 degree protection because it just has a camera pointing straight forward but i think thats what helps false alerts because it only watches the road.
customer_reviews.author: Bret

customer_reviews.title: I have definitely avoided getting rolled by the popo half ...
customer_reviews.text: I have definitely avoided getting rolled by the popo half a dozen times or so... Sometimes it picks them up a mile away! The only annoyance is the new Kia SUV's and some Porsche's have K band radar that set it off. My car doesn't have that feature so I don't know how the CR90 would work if you owned a car with that.
customer_reviews.author: DonkeyKong777

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's 20th Bday. I had it gift wrapped by Amazon. The gift wrap was nice but the actual product box seemed like it had been opened prior to my purchase. It was missing the suction cups so my son has not been able to use it. Disappointing and use caution if you pourchase this item.
customer_reviews.author: BMW21304

customer_reviews.title: Works but can drive you crazy
customer_reviews.text: Its not bad for the money. There are a couple of settings to change to reduce the amount of false alarms but there are still way too many Laser false alarms. Would be a lot better if you could turn laser off. It definitely picks up KA band which is what state troopers and local cops use in the states I travel. LA, MS, AL & FL
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Price

customer_reviews.title: I didn't have good luck with this product
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my unit was defective. I've had a Cobra in my vehicle for years as i travel a lot for work. Got this one for my spouse. Out of the box one side of the indicator lights did not work and it alarmed incessantly without cause. Worked with support to ensure it wasn't a user error or off setting.. I and ended up returning it for refund and purchasing a different brand for him.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stepp

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It's a good thing, it's responsive, and it's helped me a lot in the last month. The only thing I didn't like about it was that even at the lowest volume it was a little loud.
customer_reviews.author: Zhenhua Liang

customer_reviews.title: ... checked for updates and whistler said the "S" model like I had also needed a firmware update
customer_reviews.text: After about 6 months I checked for updates and whistler said the "S" model like I had also needed a firmware update, I should have left it alone! After updates were downloaded I plug it in and have never got it to turn on again. Bought new cord tried a factor reset tried to run new updates again but will not power up, I read other reviewers that had the same problem. I'll Never buy a Whistler product again! Should have learned when I had problems with the Whistler before this one.
customer_reviews.author: Brett A

customer_reviews.title: Good. I recommend.
customer_reviews.text: It's unbelievably good. You have to search and check the type of equipment your county police uses. You have to be patient and calmly play with the settings( you'll get it in a day or two, it's not rocket science) so it doesn't go off all the time. I removed a star because it does miss warning you 10% of the time and the manual that comes with it is bad.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure it will fit in the adapter of your car.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know that it had to be compatible with what you drive...I have a 2019 Mitsubishi Outlander sport and the adapter that connects to the cigarette lighter will plug in...so it's money wasted for me. I didn't assume that it wouldn't fit so I threw away the box and everything...
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: If you want a ticket, buy this radar!
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the damn money they spent on the plastic making this junk. Got a damn ticket first day cuz it didn't work right. 300.00 ticket! Never buy this crap again! Gonna return asap!
customer_reviews.author: Vernilia

customer_reviews.title: ATTN: lead footed drivers! YouNeed!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install, setup, operate, and understand. Its straight up to the point, no confusing button sequences, or lingo. Saved me from a couple speed traps around town that I wasnt aware of. Great buy, great price 👍 "Its easy to speed, so getcha one of these"
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I did see that Whistler now offers a 2 year warranty so I might take a chance and just get a replacement since I also hear that
customer_reviews.text: Detector performed flawlessly until display stopped working after only 2 days of use. Sending it back for a refund. I did see that Whistler now offers a 2 year warranty so I might take a chance and just get a replacement since I also hear that their customer service is great. However, a unit this capable and expensive should not be failing like this. These CR90's are notorious for dying after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: kytrex

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for... this cr70 model is crap
customer_reviews.text: What they don’t tell you is that this is an old cheap model that’s not upgraded, so it goes off every other minute from newer cars that emit frequency bands. Buy a newer more expensive radar detector.. Does this radar detector work? Yes, but it picks up everything.. How are you going to determine what is real radar gun or just another car? Annoying buy on my end, I should have done more research.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BLOWN AWAY AT THIS RADAR DETECTOR IN PRICE, QUALITY AND FUNCTIONS vs MAJOR COMPETITORS
customer_reviews.text: DO YOU KNOW THAT WHISTLER'S M.S.R.P. ON THIS RADAR DETECTOR IS $275? I CAN'T SAY MORE. I'VE OWNED MORE THAN A DOZEN RADAR DETECTORS ......... THIS IS THE VERY BEST AND YOU WOULD BE LACKING IF YOU NEED A RADAR DETECTOR AND DID NOT PURCHASE THIS UNIT. THE FUNCTIONS ARE AMAZING. I'm BLOWN AWAY AT THE PRICE PAID vs THE COMPARISONS AND COST OF OTHER WELL-KNOWN UNITS. JEFF KIRBY- NOTASULGA, AL
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Kirby

customer_reviews.title: That’s it works
customer_reviews.text: It’s the Second one and neither one of them works very long?? Only other thing I didn’t get a address to send it back too Please advise Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Donna L Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastically useful detector, albeit not super easy to manipulate
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, often from much further out than one would expect. Sometimes I wonder if it is actually detecting properly though, sometimes down my regular routes it will detect a laser repeatedly when most other times it won't. I do wish it could be quieter on volume 1/9 or use less intense light notification at night. It is sort of difficult to adjust the settings depending on what you're changing. Altogether though I would absolutely recommend it to friends and family, once you take the time to read the instructions and understand how to manipulate it according to your needs, it works phenomenoly well. It's definitely saved my ass a number of times, especially with the POP technology.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Percy

customer_reviews.title: We were delighted at first with this item and contacted the company ...
customer_reviews.text: We were delighted at first with this item and contacted the company after it quit working. Sent it to company for trouble shooting.They sent it back and said, everything checked out fine, as per manufacture instructions it auto shuts off about 3 hours of use...what a pain, as it won't come back on even after 30 min. We travel a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: Complete waste of money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product did not work. Used this on a 3.5 hr road trip not once did it alert correctly! Multiple police seen. It does work when passing by a radar sign however.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D

customer_reviews.title: honey likes it
customer_reviews.text: great product for the help on the long highway trips, only issue is that it also picks up gmc & chevy suv's frequency. dont know why but it does.
customer_reviews.author: sandysab1

customer_reviews.title: Cheap insurance against radar
customer_reviews.text: The CR73 had good overall ratings, especially long range detection for under $100. It’s good but it picks up too many false alarms and is annoying in the city or highway. I needed something for a third car in the family and was on sale in Amazon. I run it all the time in City mode blocking out X band. I mostly drive across Pennsylvania. I’ve been lucky over 30 years of using radar detectors. It’s cheap insurance against radar. Just noisy.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Peter C. Zubritzky

customer_reviews.title: The best performing detector under $400
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this detector 5 stars on the second day of having because it has already saved me twice. Police were set up in two NEW hiding spots along my commute and the CR90 gave ample warning and allowed me to slow in time. I can't recommend the product enough, well worth your money (especially on sale). Keeping the law of diminishing returns in mind, this is the BEST detector on the market for your money. A few extra features like on the Max 2 do not justify $600. Look no further! It will pay for itself - maybe even in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Detector at an Excellent Price
customer_reviews.text: A very, very good radar detector. I use this detector around town as I have a top-rated Valentine One detector (5-Star+ unit) for the highway. In town, this detector does a completely adequate job of detecting local radar. Could easily be used on the highway, but does not detect radar at the distances that Valentine does. Despite the shorter detection range, I highly recommended the unit at this price for all-around usage.
customer_reviews.author: Norman Marek

customer_reviews.title: NEVER stops making noise. Its always picking up an ...
customer_reviews.text: NEVER stops making noise. Its always picking up an alert. This is the first whistler that I've owned. It now resides in my truck only because I can't bring myself to throw 170 dollars in the trash can. After this I think I'll go back to using Cobra or Beltronics.
customer_reviews.author: robert collins

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC DETECTOR
customer_reviews.text: The best detector I have ever owned. Documentation is a bit to be desired. Found a video online to learn how to use device. Works better and further out than any I have previously owned(Cobra). Blue color is nice and visible in bright sun. Love the Quiet button as going by newer vehicles with all the sensors sets this bad boy off.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back. By the time the siren went off you were in the radar.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fontenot

customer_reviews.title: Decent; Edit: After 1 year it's having problems
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Older version I had that is no longer sold had a nicer blue screen and had a voice that would say what band it was. This seems slightly more accurate though and doesn't get set off by Audis and BMWs as much. Edit: It's been about a year and it's almost constantly going off for laser. Makes it pretty unusable and I may have to replace it soon.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Hellman

customer_reviews.title: Headphone jack unusable. Probable hearing damage.  Save money and by the 5 star cr85 unit
customer_reviews.text: I own and use the Whistler Cr85 Laser Radar Detector and give it 5 stars, but I bought the cr90 specifically to use the headphone jack while on my Ducati. First off the jack is the obsolete 2.5 mm that does not fit any present day headphones so I purchased an adaptor 2.5 to 3.5 to my dismay the unit amp is way above the threshold of hearing damage even on the lowest volume making the headphone jack completely worthless for which you pay a significant premium over the cr85 unit. Just purchase the cr85 and save your money. It begs the question...who the heck in R&D at whistler thought this was ok?!
customer_reviews.author: DPAZ

customer_reviews.title: after getting stuck in a speed trap that cost me a pretty penny (I hadn't had a speeding ticket in 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: Since high school, I haven't owned a radar detector as I don't really need one. But, after getting stuck in a speed trap that cost me a pretty penny (I hadn't had a speeding ticket in 2 decades) it seemed like a good investment. I'm not all savvy about how they work, et al. I do know that when it makes noise, I pay better attention. Well, I pay better attention in any case, but this device is helpful. It's already made me even more aware of changing speed limits.
customer_reviews.author: trowbar

customer_reviews.title: Stay away
customer_reviews.text: Ya I wanted to like this but it sucked!!!! Stay away from this product went off in my garage in the county.
customer_reviews.author: Achilles

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money....
customer_reviews.text: This radar detector goes off NONSTOP! Literally alarms every 2-10 seconds, even on the least sensitive setting on the highway....totally useless and a waste of money. 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Julie-r

customer_reviews.title: JUNK! Worse than my 2003 Whistler
customer_reviews.text: this think is BS. I still have my $40 dollar walmart Whistler from high school in 2003 and it works great. This thing just constantly blinks and beeps . IN OTHER WORDS IT DOESNT WORK
customer_reviews.author: O'bummer

customer_reviews.title: Too many false alarms
customer_reviews.text: I've had Whistler radar detectors in the past but I was very disappointed with the number of false alarms this unit puts out. Driving on the Mass Pike it seems to go off passing every sign post and mile marker, constant noise and alerts, very distracting and not conducive to carrying on a conversation with a passenger. Maybe once since I've had the unit has there actually been a LEO doing speed enforcement.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya M. Mullin

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: One of the flashing led indicator light doesn't flash on the one I recieved, but everything else seems to work.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great radar detector for the price if you don't mind a slight rattle
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic radar detector. Pros: Excellent detection of X, K, Ka, and Laser, multiple driving modes, GPS, bright screen, loud alert speaker, USB charger on 12V plug (doesn't waste the cigarette lighter port). Cons: Does rattle quite noticeably when you are in a reasonably quiet car. For example it seems really loud in a BMW 318i, but not too noticeable in an old Corolla. I suspect it wouldn't be too hard to fix this rattling though. For the money, I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Lues

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product since August, it is now October. I'm on my second unit because the first never worked properly. The second one stopped working and will not cut on. I would definitely NOT recommend this device or calling in for support because the support is clueless. I wish I had two more hands so I could give the product and Amazon support 4 thumbs down. Thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Jamaal Richard

customer_reviews.title: A positive is that the warning sounds aren't particularly annoying, so they don't drive you nuts when beeping ...
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive. Display clear and understandable. It would help if the manual contained more descriptions of the various modes. Features that could be improved are: auto quiet could be a little quieter; An auto dim mode that really goes dark at night. A positive is that the warning sounds aren't particularly annoying, so they don't drive you nuts when beeping like some detectors. Sensitivity is so good that it takes some patience, attention, learning curve, and the band ID modes for Ka & laser, to begin to understand which warnings are real vs spurious. Overall very satisfied with purchase, so far.
customer_reviews.author: WNYcust

customer_reviews.title: No happy
customer_reviews.text: It is a cheap radar so by the time it detect a laser your are too close to the coop, also a lot of false signal
customer_reviews.author: Raywilinsson Ega

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I used it for the first time on vacation and it worked perfectly. I use it everyday and I don't get all the false readings that you get with lessor models.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it goes off all the time
customer_reviews.text: this damn thing never shuts up! I got it set at the lowest settings and still it goes off all the time and I never see any cops!
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Davis

customer_reviews.title: Once good but its time is over
customer_reviews.text: This did work pretty well but eventually stopped really detecting before eventually failing to even power up. It was good for the money at the time, detected well enough in advance and has lockout for annoying K-band blind spot detectors and what not.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wyse

customer_reviews.title: Very sensitive and goes off for everything.
customer_reviews.text: This thing goes off at everything that it sees so I just unplugged it and don’t use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT DO THE JOB
customer_reviews.text: This product has way too many false alerts and I got a ticket Saturday. I just looked to see about returning it and apparently the window to make the return, is closed so I'm stuck with something that does not do what it is supposed to do. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Joan T

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: Nice little radar detector for the price. It's very easy to read and understand.
customer_reviews.author: Kwame

customer_reviews.title: radar
customer_reviews.text: The radar works good on the open highway. I have not used it for city driving yet.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Horrible at detecting anything other than other cars radar frequencies
customer_reviews.text: Horrible at detecting anything other than other cars radar frequencies. Lane departure warnings, blind spot warnings? Lots of noise and sound! Radar or Lidar from a cop? Zero.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: great detector
customer_reviews.text: love it! had to turn off everything K and under for the city as it goes off way too much, but this picks up everything. the updates via usb for red light cams is a nice touch. I bought the intellicord separate as this just has the normal charging cord (with a usb port, which is nice) so that I could silence the alerts easier than reaching all the way across the dash. if you do not have the cigarette lighter port within easy reach, dont bother with an intellicord.
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: This Detector is perfect! It works great
customer_reviews.text: This Detector is perfect! It works great, filters most of the random signals out while still giving great coverage. The design is attractive and blends in well. I would buy more if I had another car.
customer_reviews.author: nan

customer_reviews.title: Like it but omg it gets annoying
customer_reviews.text: Like it but omg it gets annoying. K ban goes off ALL THE TIME no matter what setting. I sometimes get fed up with its constant beeping, that I unplug it and go without
customer_reviews.author: Amber mckee

customer_reviews.title: although i hightly recommend you to not speed due to the fact that ...
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose well, although i hightly recommend you to not speed due to the fact that cops in certain states love lasers and by the time it detects it it is to late my state however alot of cops use the ka band and usually i see them pretty quickyly and can adjust my speed according to the posted speed limit in a decent amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah A.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the response time
customer_reviews.text: We replaced our 7 year old whistler with this unit after researching for several weeks. After taking it on the road, we were very pleased with the improvement in detection distances. Am still playing with some of the settings but that comes with time. Very happy with the product, although the instruction booklet could have been printed in a font size that is readable.
customer_reviews.author: Roshanda

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, not as good as they say it is
customer_reviews.text: Very late warnings and lots of false warnings too... I’d Look around a lot before buying this radar detector. The tests on it don’t have good results. I will be returning this item 100%
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Rusher

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It worked good to start with but I think it may have got too hot and now it geeks out
customer_reviews.author: Shyla

customer_reviews.title: Noise maker that's all unreliable!
customer_reviews.text: This crap goes off all day ever day. Had it side by side my cobra radar detector that I've had for 17 years thinking that the new Whistler would be so much better, boy was I do wrong. It made noise non stop from sun up to see sun down, could not rely on it at all! I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: DARRYL Y.

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Have 3 on them
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Have 3 on them. No more expensive tickets
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Timmerberg

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: After working fine for 6 months, this suddenly just quit. It suddenly started making every noise it can and lighting every light. Then started flashing POWER OFF. Now it is dead. Won’t turn on, zero. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne B

customer_reviews.title: Picks up everything
customer_reviews.text: I like the sounds, not super annoying. It has a quiet button so you do not have to worry about muting it/unmutting it every time. Only bad thing is that it picks up every little thing.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easy to program if you want to fool with the settings. Seven more words are required to submit this review, so here they are Amazon...
customer_reviews.author: MarkG

customer_reviews.title: Decent for what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.text: Picks up on lasers and K-Band really well. Some false alarms with X. Also, through my observation a few cars make my detector go off. Overall, pretty good. Audi - Q7, Q5 VW - Atlas Chevy - Tahoe, Suburban Toyota - Sienna
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Paid for itself the first day!
customer_reviews.text: Saved my a$$ the first day I used it! Easy to install and set up. The range is pretty good if you have line of sight. Will usually give an early blip if around curves or corners before delivering a more steady warning. The unit is a little bigger than I expected it to be and is very light weight. Was very happy to find the USB port on the top of the charger so that I could still charge my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic A. Reina

customer_reviews.title: Good value, but not best device available.
customer_reviews.text: Performs well enough for the price, but there are better devices out there. Particularly it doesn't have the ability to lock out false alerts that are always at the same location on the same frequency.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Even after adjusting settings properly and to my needs, ...
customer_reviews.text: Even after adjusting settings properly and to my needs, I still get all the same false signals I did with my little $30 Whistler. I didn't even know I was ordering the same brand until I put them side by side. But you learn what's what at your regular driving hotspots, so it still does its job. Speed safely my dudes.
customer_reviews.author: Rei

customer_reviews.title: Wat the flock?
customer_reviews.text: I am clueless. Still trying to figure the flokking directions!! But it does look nice and it arrived in a nice box!!😜
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: This does not always work! It skips around a ...
customer_reviews.text: This does not always work! It skips around a lot or not working. I am going to have to buy another on
customer_reviews.author: Joan Beynon

customer_reviews.title: pass on this one
customer_reviews.text: Too many false alerts and range isn't great. Feels flimsy & cheaply built
customer_reviews.author: dougy

customer_reviews.title: Detector.
customer_reviews.text: Works has a lot of features that I don’t quite understand. I have to turn it on sometimes when I have it on a hot plug.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: Price
customer_reviews.text: The item is very good and very sporty and it have more in the system than what u think it have is a very good device.
customer_reviews.author: Wrong item

customer_reviews.title: Saved me 4 times on roadtrip across country!
customer_reviews.text: On 4 separate occasions while crossing the United States, this detector saved my butt. Ka band warned me perfectly, allowing me to slow down before a trap.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price!!
customer_reviews.text: Great radar locater!! Saved me from getting a few tickets!!
customer_reviews.author: Tim E.

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: i can pick up police 1 and 1/2 mile away, best radar i have ever had
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Marvin Harris

customer_reviews.title: Does its job really well!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good radar and it does its job. I travel frequently and didn't get pulled over at all. Sends the alerts in a timely manner. One incident I had a cop in front of me and it didn't pick it up but that's probably because the gun was facing forward. I strongly recommend this product. I did my research before deciding if I wanted this one or a different brand. Went for this one.
customer_reviews.author: JESAN84

customer_reviews.title: Great deal. TSFR feature works well.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and one of the few detectors with a feature to reduce false alarms for highway traffic monitoring radar (TSFR) feature. This is a big advantage. If any of the other reviews mention ongoing false alarms, there is a chance they did not know of this feature. Manual is vague. I figured it out with a few Internet searches only.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great, very sinsitive!
customer_reviews.text: It is maybe a little too sensitive to false alarms, but I would rather have a few extra alarm sounds in my car than miss one that will cost me $$$. Very good, reliable, and affordable detector!
customer_reviews.author: Olga M

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Display is not bad and the response to radar is great. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: GREAT RADAR FOR 35 DAY ONLY...
customer_reviews.text: its a great radar ONLY if you need it for 35days lol, after that, IT WONT WORK NO MORE... its nice but its only good for decoration on my car because its do not work no more and I CAN'T exchange it or return it, ....$150 to the trash in 35days...
customer_reviews.author: Lucio Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Works if the charging plug doesn’t short out like minded
customer_reviews.text: The car plug charger already has a short in it and I will probably have to pay to get a new one for this to work for the price that I paid for this I shouldn’t be having this problem
customer_reviews.author: LORRI

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good unit for the price. Picks up Vascar and stationary hand held radar for as much as a mile distant depending on strength that the officer has the unit set at. I generally run it on a CITY rather than HIGHWAY setting. It is quite sensitive and also picks up other security signals and signals to highway signs which can be a bit annoying, but I would rather have the sensitivity/warning.
customer_reviews.author: Orchidman

customer_reviews.title: Got a ticket
customer_reviews.text: I bought the item on Oct 10th, got a ticket on nov 23. Worked for about 5 weeks. The reader detector did sound, but when it did it was too late. Normally it starts detecting the signal from 1-9 (weak to strong). I wasn’t left with much space to slow down when it started going off on 9(really strong). Would not buy again or buy for friends
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Radar detector
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a Christmas gift and I assume it is working fine
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth T Davis

product_meta.title: Whistler CR88 High Performance Laser Radar Detector: 360 Degree Protection and Bilingual Voice Alerts,Black
product_meta.description: Style:CR88The Whistler CR88 laser radar detector is a high performance, professional grade dash model which detects all radar guns used today with total band protection, including X-band, K-band, Superwide Ka-band, and laser. Total laser detection identifies Laser Atlanta Stealth mode, Laser Ally, and the new LTI Truspeed S. It delivers 360 degrees of complete perimeter protection, detecting signals from the front, sides, and rear. Features Radar Signature ID (RSID) which is a Ka-band radar identifier that displays Ka 33.8, 34.0, 34.3, 34.7, or 35.5 when detecting these common Ka speed radar systems. Laser Signature ID (LSID) indicates the Pulses Per Second (PPS) transmitted by speed laser or other forms of laser sources. The POP Mode detection is an advanced speed detection capability that responds to brief bursts of radar. Traffic Flow Signal Rejection (TFSR) helps eliminate alerts from radar based traffic flow sensors and the 4 XK and 4 Ka filter modes reduce false alerts caused from other radar detectors. The low emission design makes it difficult to be detected by VG-2 and other radar detector detectors. This laser radar detector includes real voice alerts and an OLED text display that shows alerts and signal strength, as well as many others, such as Stay Alert, vehicle battery saver, 3 city modes, highway mode, and alert priority that make this a feature rich detector. Measures 4.93" L x 3.12" W x 1.31" H, and includes the radar detector, a 12V power cord, hardware kit, windshield bracket kit, and a user guide.
feature_bullets: Optimum performance Radar detector with 360 degrees of complete perimeter protection; Includes 12V power cord, dash pad, direct wire kit, and windshield bracket kit
Protection against all radar guns including X-band, back-band, super wide Ka-band, and laser
Total laser detection identifies Laser Atlanta Stealth mode, Laser Ally, and LTI Truspeed S
Features Radar signature ID (RSID), Laser signature ID (LSID), and pop mode, real voice alerts, and a full text display
Traffic Flow Signal Rejection (TFSR) and XK/ka filter modes help eliminate alerts from radar based traffic monitoring systems

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars2,022 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Laser Radar Detector, 12V Power Cord, Windshield Bracket Kit, Hardware Kit, User Guide
